body: Swimmers were told to stay out of the water on Sunday at Coney Island and nearby Manhattan Beach because of concerns about a sewage overflow. The city's parks department posted signs Sunday saying swimming was not permitted at the two Brooklyn beaches. But the Coney Island boardwalk was open, and sunbathing on the sand was allowed. The city's
title: Sewage Worries Close 2 Brooklyn Beaches

body: TOFU TAKEDOWN In the spirit of two wholly American pursuits -- overeating and winning -- comes the Takedown, a cooking competition where anything goes. Held in bars around town, it pits a few dozen mostly amateur contestants against one another in battles centered on dishes like chili (above), salsa or cookies. There are judges, audience favorites
title: Spare Times

body: To the Editor: Re ''The Last One Standing'' (Urban Studies, March 22), about the lone remaining Jahn's Ice Cream Parlor, in Jackson Heights, Queens: The first Jahn's Ice Cream Parlor, in Mott Haven in the Bronx, was a block away from my dental office. Many's the sandwich and ice cream soda I enjoyed there in the 1950s, '60s and '70s. In the '80s,
title: LETTERS TO THE EDITOR; The Dentist and the Ice Cream Soda

body: DANCE Full reviews of recent performances: nytimes.com/dance. ARMITAGE GONE! DANCE (Wednesday and Thursday) In celebration of the 30th anniversary of her first New York season, Karole Armitage, who has been hailed as the ''punk ballerina,'' presents Think Punk!, a retrospective that shows the development of her hard-rock ballet style. title: The Listings

body: FOR CHILDREN THUNDERBIRD AMERICAN INDIAN DANCERS Dance Concert and Powwow Every culture has its bogyman. Or bogywoman. Just such a female creature -- ''equal-opportunity scary'' -- stars in the children's matinees of the Thunderbird American Indian Dancers. title: Spare Times: For Children

body: Making Books Sing is now in its 13th season. For those who -- like me -- had not heard of this project, it takes children's books that tell stories of some social significance and adapts them into hourlong musicals for schoolchildren. (Mainly an operation within New York City, it will visit California for the first time next month.) The purpose is

body: FLEMING--Peter Emmet Jr,. of Greenwich, Connecticut, one of the great trial lawyers of his generation, died of lung cancer on Wednesday at New York Hospital, New York City. He was 79 years of age. Mr. Fleming who was born in Atlantic Highlands, NJ and was a graduate of Princeton University and Yale Law School, and served in the United States Navy
